fields_of_interest: International co-operation and development, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment
eu_initiatives:
Mission 
 
FECC is a professional federation in it's nature,  which prohibits any attachments to groups with political or religious activities. 
FECC represents and defends the common, social and economic interests of managers and professionals in the following sectors:  Building & Construction;  Demolishings to re-build, Buildings technical safety, Maintenance, Global service, Energy saving buildings, Transportation facilities and Construction procedures to perform large infrastructures, Standards and technical specifications for all above mentioned sectors. 
FECC cooperates with CEC to perform EWC in EC countries and represent the above mentioned interests at all the EC institutions. 
FECC promotes and supports technical information studies.
organisation_name: FEDERATION EUROPEENNE DES CADRES DE LA CONSTRUCTION (FECC)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
CEC Confederation Europeenne des Cadres 
Rue de la Loi  81/a; B-1040 - Bruxelles - Belgique
goals__remit:
The European Federation of Managers and Professionals in the Building & Construction sector (Fédération Européenne des Cadres de la Construction – FECC) is an Association born in 1993 under the French laws;  B&C Depts of National Unions Organizations in EC countries can join FECC.   Nowadays  Members   are: 
 
* (FRANCE) Syndicat National  des Cadres, Techniciens et Agents  de maîtrise des  Batiments, Travaux Publics et Activités connexes    (CFE-CGC-BTP), 
 
* (GERMANY) DIE FÜHRUNGSKRÄFTE - DFK, 
     
* (ITALY) Federazione nazionale dei Dirigenti industriali  (FEDERMANAGER), 
 
FECC is part of the European Managers Confederation- CEC (www.cec-managers.org) in order to perform it's mission, and must comply with the rules and Statuts of the CEC  and CIC, Managers International Confederation. 
 
 
Organization 
 
President : Paolo CANNAVO’ - Italy 
Vice-President and Treasurer : Vincent-Paul BOGUCKI - Frane 
Vice-President and General Secretary : Sebastian MÜLLER - Germany
